The **2023 Texas Rangers season** was the 63rd of the Texas Rangers franchise overall, their 52nd in Arlington as the Rangers, and the 4th season at Globe Life Field. It was also the team's first season under the management of Bruce Bochy.

## References[edit]


1. **^** Stevenson, Stefan (July 11, 2023). "Texas Rangers Six All-Stars Make History in Seattle". *SI.com*. Retrieved July 27, 2023.
2. **^** Polishuk, Mark (October 21, 2022). "Rangers Hire Bruce Bochy As Manager". *MLB Trade Rumors*. Retrieved October 25, 2022.
3. **^** "Pitch clocks and shift limits: MLB adopts sweeping rule changes for 2023". *the Guardian*. Associated Press. September 9, 2022. Retrieved October 13, 2022.

## External links[edit]


</fragment>
<fragment>

Despite leading the AL West for most of the season and finishing with the same record as the rival and defending champion Houston Astros, they finished 2nd due to the Astros owning the tiebreaker as a result of taking the season series. The Rangers defeated the Tampa Bay Rays in the Wild Card Series in a two-game sweep and the Baltimore Orioles in a three-game sweep in the ALDS to advance to the Championship Series for the first time since 2011, in which they beat their division and Lone Star Series rival, and defending World Series champions Astros in seven games to claim their first pennant since 2011. They defeated the Arizona Diamondbacks in the 5th game of the World Series to claim their first title in franchise history. The Rangers went 13-4 in the postseason going 2-4 at home and becoming the first team in MLB history to go unbeaten on the road going 11-0.

chat_history.name: search

chat_history.content:
Based on my research, here are the General Managers for the four most recent World Series winners:

1. 2023 Texas Rangers: Chris Young (Executive Vice President/General Manager)
2. 2022 Houston Astros: James Click (though he departed after the World Series win)
3. 2021 Atlanta Braves: Alex Anthopoulos (President of Baseball Operations/GM)
4. 2020 Los Angeles Dodgers: Andrew Friedman (President of Baseball Operations)

It's worth noting that in modern MLB front offices, some of these roles might be officially titled as "President of Baseball Operations" rather than "General Manager," though they serve as the top baseball operations executive. The Rangers are more traditional in having Chris Young specifically titled as Executive VP/GM.
